title: (7300-126) Portalegre - 2 Praça João Paulo II
description: Parking at the local sport's center. A lot of place to park for free. Near the new park of the city. The old part is nice, but a lot of small street's.

title: (7300-126) Portalegre - 33 Avenida George Robinson
description: Large parking area for regular cars but with enough free space to park vans. Paid parking area weekdays from 9h to 19h and Saturday from 9h to 13h. Next to a nice park, very quiet during the day and night and secure as it is next to a police training facility. Very central to visit the city and with easy access.

title: (7300) Portalegre - Senhora da Penha
description: Place aside Senhora da Penha chapel with wonderful view towards whole Portalegre town and plane at S. Water tap near long stairs down to the town. Up hill some spot for rock climbing (“Penha” = step hill). Nice to rest or take a meal, even to overnight (view to illuminated town) as this place is out of natural park limits.

title: (7300-126) Portalegre - 7 Rua 15 de Maio
description: Free park in the city. Suitable only for shorter motorhomes.

title: (7300-126) Portalegre - 40 Rua de São Bartolomeu
description: Free parking area next to the old town. 10 minutes walk from the cathedral and museums. Good option for large vehicles. has some slant

title: (7300-298) Portalegre - 102 Praça da República
description:
Near Casa Museu José Régio.
Paying from 09:00 to 19:00 week days and 09:00 to 13:00 saturday.

title: (7300-126) Portalegre - 97 Rua 1º de Maio
description: Free parking day and night with a view.

title: (7300-126) Portalegre - 1501 Rua do Poeta José Régio
title_short: (7300-126) Portalegre - 1501 Rua do Poeta José Régio
description: Parking next to the cemetery, closer to the center than the other car parks. Half is tilted, but the rise and end are flat. A little noise for cars going up but at night it is calm. An even quieter cul-de-sac begins.

title: (7330) São Salvador Aramenha -
description: Nice location by the lake of Apartadura dam, the path is easily accessible by car or van. You will be awakened by the bells of sheep and the distant cries of  shepherds. Long live the van life man? NOTE: here is natural park (Parque Natural da Serra de São Mamede), so it is forbidden to overnight.

title: (7330) - Barragem da Apartadura - W
description: Small grassy platform. No service. Accessible by dirt road, only for van. No swimming possible (you have to cross the dam to swim). In the heart of nature, isolated, calm, very pleasant. NOTE: it is forbidden to overnight because in natural park (Parque Natural da Serra de São Mamede).

title: (7330) Monte Roxo - Barragem da Apartadura
description: Beautiful and quiet places by the lake of Apartadura dam. Possibility of swimming. NOTE: here is natural park (Parque Natural da Serra de São Mamede) where it is forbidden to overnight.

title: (7300-126) Ribeira de Nisa -
description: Parking space on a lake with easy access to the water, quiet, shady, lower parking space a bit uneven, upper parking space straight, access to both parking spaces via gravel road

title: (7300-126) Portalegre - N246
description: Outdoor washing machine near the service station in the E.Leclerc car park. Two washing machines and a dryer. The bathroom in the hyper market was clean and well equipped.

title: (7300-126) Serra de São Mamede -
description: Ermida Sao Mamede! Dilapidated church. Flat places great views.

title: (7300-126) Serra de São Mamede -
description: Wonderful views from a parking spot next to the highest peak of the São Mamede mountain (1 025 m).

title: (7300-126) Bairro dos Assentos - 4 Rua Luís Pathé
title_short: (7300-126) Bairro dos Assentos - 4 Rua Luís Pathé
description: Perfect place to do laundry, good price as well. Parking just outside

title: (7300-126) Portalegre - 4 N246
description: Self service launderette with change machine

title: (7300-126) Portalegre - E802
description: Free parking at Burger King restaurant. Next to the Leclerc supermarket. With gas station. Far in front of the center but near the main road. Inaccessible in motorhome.

title: (7300-126) Portalegre - 16 Rua do Joinal
description: Tired of the noise of cities, we were looking for a place to rest quietly without noise. We walked a bit into the commercial area of Portalegre and found this residential area with lots of parking and quite flat. Highly recommended and safe to rest one night.

title: (7300) Portalegre - N246
description: We have slept in the parking lot of the stadium without problem. Road next to it but little traffic at night. Open stadium restroom.

title: (7300-126) Portalegre - 16 Rua do Joinal
description: Quiet area, in a street where there are some houses and several places to park. Pretty flat.

title: (7300-126) Portalegre - 13 Rua Mestre João Serra
description: Repsol, fills up German gas bottles, suitable adapter available!

title: (7300-126) - EM523
description: Place on the side of road top with very extended panorama to SW and W (nice sunset) and many picnic tables with seats snd shadows. There is toilet but maybe open only in summertime. NOTE: besides very low traffic by night, it is FORBIDDEN to overnight because it is in natural park (Parque Natural da Serra de São Mamede) where it is forbidden to overnight out of authorized places.

title: (7330) Toll - 5 EM1142
description: Free P in a small village (called Portagem) on N 246-1 road, midway Castelo de Vide and Valencia de Alcântara (this in Spain) and deviation to Marvão. Next to small dam used as river beach without pretension but which allows to refresh itself with big shadows on right riverside to sit and picnic. Pay swimming pool next door. Several small bar / snack / nice restaurants. Busy on summertime during daytime.

title: (7330) - 1 N246
description: Parking with fountain, picnic table and barbecue, shaded, flat, slightly back from the road on your right coming from Portagem.

title: (7330) - N246-1
description: Shaded picnic area, tables, benches, fountain and trash, located in the park of Sao Mamede, exit of the hamlet of Escusa towards Castelo de Vide. N 246-1

title: (7330) Jardim - N359
description: Picnic area with 2 shaded tables and a cool water fountain.

title: (7330) Marvão -
description: 200m from the road. Access is via a discreet path before the bridge.

title: (7330) Marvão - EM1033
description: Green space at the edge of a small road near Marvão historic village, in front of an old barn. A lot of shade and calm. NOTE: it is in natural park (Parque Natural da Serra de São Mamede) where it is forbidden to overnight out of authorized places.

title: (7330) Marvão - N359-6
description: Parking with beautiful views, quiet, within walking distance at Marvao. Drinking water and waste containers available. There are also toilets but they are sometimes closed.

title: (7330) - N359
description: Parking quite wide along the road that goes up to Marvão. Shaded. NOTE: besides quiet by night, it is forbidden to overnight because here still is natural park (Parque Natural da Serra de São Mamede) where it is forbidden to overnight out of authorized places.

title: (7320) Castelo de Vide -
description: Sloping parking at the edge of a quiet road with a magnificent view of Castelo de Vide

title: (7320) - EM1008
description: Small P with views of Castelo de Vide small town and surrounding (planes to N). Good for stopover on the way. A couple of benches and a trash can. Shadow option.

title: (7330) Marvão -
description: Fountain with drinking water Good parking

title: (7320) - EM1008
description: Small flat area along the road with superb views of whole Castelo de Vide small town at lower level and surroundings. No service. NOTE: besides very quiet traffic by night, it is FORBIDDEN to overnight because this area integrates Natural Park (Parque Natural da Serra de São Mamede) and, so, it is forbidden overnight out authorized places.

title: (7330) Marvão - N359
description: Better, stronger, faster, fresher source of potable water

title: (7320) Castelo de Vide - N 246-1, Estrada de São Vicente
title_short: (7320) Castelo de Vide - N 246-1, Estrada de São Vicente
description: Quiet flat parking behind the sports hall and aside open swimming pool.

name: Quinta do Pomarinho
title: (7320 421) Quinta do Pomarinho
description: Small campsite run by a friendly French-speaking Dutchman. Clean toilets. Free WIFI.

title: (7320) - Ermida de Nossa Senhora da Penha
title_short: (7320)  - Ermida de Nossa Senhora da Penha
description: Picnic area just aside road and at lower level of small chapel of Senhora da Penha. From chapel (710m high, accessible by stairs), superb view of whole Castelo de Vide small town, at lower level, and surrounding including Estrela Mountain further to N. Several picnic tables with seats and fountain. Parking has slope. NOTE: besides very quiet traffic by night, overnight is FORBIDDEN because this area integrates Natural Park (Parque Natural da Serra de São Mamede) and, so, overnight is forbidden out authorized places.

address.street: Ermida de Nossa Senhora da Penha

title: (7320) Castelo de Vide - 6 EM1006-2
description:
Forest garden nomad base in nature. Beautiful wild land were your contribution cooperates with the guardianship of this diverse ecosystem. Bright stars and singing birds everywhere. 15minutes walking distance from the poetic medieval village of Castelo de Vide. Volunteering may be available for longer stays. Bring only organic soap.
No smokers.

title: (7320) Castelo de Vide - 40 Praceta Amadeu Canário
title_short: (7320) Castelo de Vide - 40 Praceta Amadeu Canário
description: Good place to park, safe overnight. Picnic park with barbecue and sink. Very close to the downtown. Wc in the small park below.

title: (7320-111) Castelo de Vide - 2 Travessa dos Mouzinhos
title_short: (7320-111) Castelo de Vide - 2 Travessa dos Mouzinhos
description: Parking without restrictions for vans.

name: Quinta do Maral - naturist camping
title: (7330-205) Quinta do Maral - naturist camping
description: It is an exclusive NATURIST campsite, surrounded by nature, open all year round. Very familiar, friendly and clean. The way to get there is to take aldeia, not follow the GPS. If you want to empty sewage, only with organic products. Small pool but cozy. Little shadows for large vehicles, the trees still very young and small, but in a tent if a cool and shady place. Peace of mind assured.

title: (7320-148) Castelo de Vide - 32 Largo Capitão Fernando Salgueiro Maia
title_short: (7320-148) Castelo de Vide - 32 Largo Capitão Fernando Salgueiro Maia
description: Excellent place to stay... With bakery at 100m, cafes, tourism, etc.

title: (7320) Castelo de Vide - 6 N246-1
description: Drinking water - water point recommended by locals (September 2022) for safe drinking water from old picturesque well. Since there can be fluctuations in the quality of the water, as everywhere, it is best to check or inquire with the locals, for example at the local café.

title: () Castelo de Vide - 5 Rua Luís de Camões
title_short: () Castelo de Vide - 5 Rua Luís de Camões
description: Market place. Small vehicles only.

title: (7320) Castelo de Vide - 3 Estrada da Circunvalação
title_short: (7320) Castelo de Vide - 3 Estrada da Circunvalação
description: Another parking option to visit the city of Castellón de Vile. It is a parking lot for cars but with enough background for motorhomes. We only ate and visited the city. I do not know if there are problems to spend the night.

title: (7320) Castelo de Vide - Estrada da Circunvalação
title_short: (7320) Castelo de Vide - Estrada da Circunvalação
description: Panoramic view with picnic table and water point, small parking.

title: (7320) Castelo de Vide - N246-1
description: Source of water unverified but very clear?

name: Camping Asseiceira
title: (7330) Camping Asseiceira
description:
Small, friendly campsite in a beautiful olive grove with views to the castle of Marvão.

Tranquil location, yet just a few minutes walk to the village of Santo Antonio das Areias which has a Restaurant, Cafes, Bars, Shops, a Pharmacy and an indoor municipal Swimming Pool.

name: Campscape Beira Marvao Alentejo
title: (7330-013) Campscape Beira Marvao Alentejo
description:
We are an camping escape for adults (16+) with a minimum stay of 2 nights on a beautiful estate - landscape park. Our terrain is not accessible for vehicles lager than 7,5 meters. Trailers and cars HAVE to be parked in the parking areas. Please, don't call or email: you will find all information including the possibility to make a reservation ON OUR WEBSITE. Trust the reviews.

Vitor, Ronald and Dushi welcome you to their friendly rural and natural site in the heart of the spectacular Parque Natural da Serra de São Mamede. The perfect place to walk, cycle and relax. Visit us and discover the positive energy of Alto Alentejo, which is still largely unknown, with the castle villages of Marvão, Castelo de Vide and the old train station of Beirã. Share your experiences with a good glass of local wine and a snack on the terrace of the kiosk Amsterdao. We provide a safe and friendly home away from home for everybody, because ... Under the stars, we are all small and alike.

title: (7300) Alegrete - EM517-2
description: Lovely old village (castle) with 12 parking spaces (lot of them are not levelled). Stunning views of mountains and old village. There is a water tap yet we did not tried it. NOTE: it still lies in natural park (Parque Natural da Serra de São Mamede) where it is forbidden to overnight out of authorized places.

title: (10514) Valencia de Alcántara - CC-154
description: Spacious place, parking for cars nearby, picnic area, the border between Portugal and Valencia de Alcantara (11 km). It is made of light. Playground. Ideal for visiting the dolmens

name: Camping Aguas Claras
title: (10515) Camping Aguas Claras
description: Camping Aguas Claras camping in the middle of nature. Incredible place from where to start to do countless routes. The campsite is very basic with very basic maintenance too, at least in the low season, which is when we were there. Very friendly staff. From there we did the route of the dolmens, highly recommended.

title: (7330-012) Beirã - 1 Largo da Alfândega
description: Free parking at Marvao Beira station, abandoned historic station, quiet place. Interesting to discover and do a "bike on rails" activity where you can pedal on the rails.

name: Cumeada da Ponte
title: (7320-419) Cumeada da Ponte
description: Quinta Alto da Cumeada is a private rural farm that lets stay overnight. Really under the stars; seeing the farm animals (possible to buy products). Owners are very friendly and speak other languages. It is just 10 min from Castelo de Vide. Convenient call before arrive.

title: (10500) Valencia de Alcántara - 2 Plaza de Toros
title_short: (10500) Valencia de Alcántara - 2 Plaza de Toros
description: Next to bullring. Very central.

title: (10500) Valencia de Alcántara - 17 Calle Extremadura
description: Small parking area in a cul-de-sac. very close to the town center. there is no service. not suitable for very large vehicles.

title: (10519) Lanchuelas -
description: Beautiful spot in nature with great view on the little lake. Very quiet. Shade available, good surface, flat. Nice walks. Good acces, we were with 7,50 camper. Clean, please keep clean and enjoy nature.

title: (10500) Valencia de Alcántara - 3 Calle Uno
description: Galp gas station with personalized refueling service, with a small supermarket and homemade bread of the day, bathrooms and showers at 3 euros per person

title: (7320) Barragem de Nisa -
description:
A nice and quiet place next to a clean lake. only two other vans were parked here. the road is accessible!
only park here if you are a nature lover and have your own toilet. respect nature and keep it clean! enjoy!

title: (10500) Valencia de Alcántara - Camino de Alpotrel
title_short: (10500) Valencia de Alcántara - Camino de Alpotrel
description: On the west bank of the reservoir, parking spaces for anglers, no prohibition signs. No services. Hiking trails, quiet, at least during the week.

title: (7430) Crato - 23A Rua António José de Almeida
title_short: (7430) Crato - 23A Rua António José de Almeida
description: Public park in the vilage

title: (7430) Flor da Rosa - Av do Condestavel
title_short: (7430) Flor da Rosa - Av do Condestavel
description: In front of the Flor da Rosa Monastery. Very quiet and with flat squares. The monastery, despite being a pousada, can be visited.

title: (7430) Crato - Rua 25 de Abril
description: Future service station near the pools

title: (6050) Alpalhão - 2 Largo Doutor António Alves da Costa
title_short: (6050) Alpalhão - 2 Largo Doutor António Alves da Costa
description: Gravel parking with few leveled places, inside village but aside stone paved road to Castelo de Vide. Toilets and water next to a playground. Several cafés, restaurants and pastries nearby. Easy walking to historic center; several modern granite sculptures inside village.

address.street: 2 Largo Doutor António Alves da Costa

title: (7320) Barragem de Nisa - EM1007
description: Nice and nice place with the water next. Nickel for the night and the ground is flat. Just there is a little noise from the factory a little before. Beware a lot of otter family.

title: (06518) La Codosera - BA-053
description: Ample parking and abundant shade, with natural pool, snack bar and possibility of taking water

title: (7320) Barragem de Nisa -
description: Shortly before the dam, a small path that leads to a site with benches. But by following the lake on the small path, you will come across THE little nugget. Shaded with access to sunny parts, tranquility assured, birdsong, otters, swimming in the lake possible, highly recommended. There is another location after the dam which gives access to drinking water, and has garbage cans. Please leave this place clean!

title: (7320) - EM1007
description:
Pleasant to park on site, near Póvoa e Meadas dam, accessible for swimming. It has a picnic area and a public grill, with a sink and running water. To be used only during daylight. 
NOTE: it is FORBIDDEN to overnight because this area integrates natural park (Parque Natural da Serra de São Mamede) where it is forbidden to overnight out of authorized places.

name: Parque de autocaravanas Albufeira de Póvoa e Meadas
title: (7320) Parque de autocaravanas Albufeira de Póvoa e Meadas
title_short: (7320) Parque de autocaravanas Albufeira de Póvoa e Meadas
description: Pitch renewed at the end of 2022, with full camper service. Access via barrier where you have to register on the Outdoor site which requires a lot of personal data and takes a few minutes; payment by card. View over the dam of Póvoa e Meadas. Toilet block with cold showers. Nice, quiet and clean. Beautiful walking routes, wonderful cycling and a refreshing lake for swimming.

title: (06500) San Vicente de Alcántara - 2003 Camino de la Vega
title_short: (06500) San Vicente de Alcántara - 2003 Camino de la Vega
description: Large area with very quiet picnic areas. You can stay overnight

title: (7320) Póvoas e Meadas - Unnamed Road
description: Small farm. Flat. Grass. Water, electricity. No other facilities. Nature, clean, no stench.

title: (06518) La Codosera -
description: Small area to park right by the river, both sides are possible as you can cross the ford right there. Very quiet at night, an occasional dog bark. Very rural and surrounded by nature. Some locals passed by, all waved and said Hola!

title: (06500) San Vicente de Alcántara - 5 Lugar Canchos Blancos
title_short: (06500) San Vicente de Alcántara - 5 Lugar Canchos Blancos
description: Ideal for one night. The calm next to the hermitage is accessible by the slope but no problem for motorhomes.

title: (06518) La Codosera - 16 Calle Molinos
description: Ideal picnic area to spend the night. 500m from the town. Bathing area in the river. Lots of shade and quiet.

title: (7440) Alter do Chão - 2 Rua das Amoreiras
title_short: (7440) Alter do Chão - 2 Rua das Amoreiras
description: New paid aire in Alter de Chao, price including electricity. Reasonable flat area and good access to the town

title: (7460) Cabeço de Vide - N369
description: Great place, termas da sulfurea. Amazing free pool with water unique in world (confirm by NASA)

title: (7440-022) Alter do Chão - 196 Avenida da Coudelaria de Alter
title_short: (7440-022) Alter do Chão - 196 Avenida da Coudelaria de Alter
description: Public parking next to the castle and the municipal market

name: Ponte do Crato
title: (7340) Ponte do Crato
description: 5 double tables with seats and grill, without shadows, just left Caia riverside; P on SE of Crato bridge. It is 250m away from free motorhome area (read its introduction to learn more).

title: (7450) - IP2
description: Well-spaced lot quite far out in the country, situated next to the through road IP2. At night, there seems to be not too much traffic. It has the shape of a small roundabout, but there's no passing traffic. Just slightly sloping. There are some picnic tables and benches installed out here. Not a site of outstanding beauty, but quite alright for passing a night.

title: (7440) Alter do Chão - N369
description: Free parking

title: (7340) Arronches - Largo da Restauração
description: Free flat parking on wide L-shape street back castle tower and toy museum. Easy walking access to historic center, tourist office, restaurants and traditional shopping. May be busy on working hours.

title: (7340) Arronches - 22 Bairro do Telheiro
description: 5-space car park on the outskirts of the village which looks rather calm, with a nice setting on a beautiful large river, tables a little set back for a quiet meal, drinking water €2

title: (7440) Alter do Chão -
description: Intermarché with laundry facility on parking lot. Cheap fuel here as well.

title: (7340-002) Arronches - Rua A
description: Free public flat P aside Centro Cultural de Arronches and police (GNR) with reasonable pedestrian access to historic center and local shopping; quiet enough to overnight and illuminated.

title: (06500) San Vicente de Alcántara - Camino de Las Charcas
title_short: (06500) San Vicente de Alcántara - Camino de Las Charcas
description: The ponds quiet areas and drinking water wide and flat area

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Near Arronches, set back from the roads, a small space surrounded by olive trees and sheep. Quiet. For small transport type combi.

title: (7340) Arronches -
description: Place near the town, an alternative to the motorhome area since it was full when we arrived.

name: Camping and Caravaning Park Lapa dos Gaivões
title: (7340-111) Camping and Caravaning Park Lapa dos Gaivões
title_short: (7340-111) Camping and Caravaning Park Lapa dos Gaivões
description: Camping and Caravanning Park Lapa dos Gaivões Hortas de Baixo cx  Esperança Arronches Opening period: From April 1 to September 30: 7 a.m. to 11 p.m. From October 1 to March 31: 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. The campsite is part of the natural park of the Serra de S. Mamede. Walk along the various approved trails, ride a bicycle, visit the rich historical or natural heritage, bathe in a swimming pool or river beach, go canoeing, observe birds, delight in Alentejo cuisine, or simply resting, are some of the activities to which the visitor can dedicate himself and in which he can have fun. The large spaces to settle, an open leisure space next to a small line of water that originates in the park and forms a natural swimming pool, offer the visitor an environment of peace, calm and tranquility. 15% discount on stays of more than 6 nights excluding electricity; 25% discount on stays of more than 15 nights excluding electricity.Special discounts for extended stays from October 1 to May 31:One week:-20%;15 days:-30%;1 month:-40%;2 months:- 50%.

title: (6050-327) Nisa - 38 Rua Doutor Sidónio Pais
description: Large paved parking lot. Without services. Busy street during the day. 20 minutes walk from the center of the medieval village.

title: (6050) Nisa - 3 Rua dos Lusíadas
description: Asphalt and quiet free public P, located just opposite the Intermarché supermarket (also has cafeteria) inside small town of Nisa. No sign prohibiting parking. It's pretty but very noisy due to shopping users after 08:30. This P is not charming; there is another behind NW that is quieter.

name: Posto de Turismo de Nisa
title: (6050-350) Posto de Turismo de Nisa
description: Flat and lighted free public park very close to the central garden and next to the tourist office and craft shops. Not suitable for vehicles over 6.5 m in length. Easy pedestrian access to the historic center.

title: (6050) Nisa - 19 Rua dos Lusíadas
description: Launderette open from 08:00 to 22:00

title: (6050) Nisa - 43 Estrada das Amoreiras
description: Park with water fountain and tables for outdoor meals.

title: (7450-114) Monforte - 15 Rua Augusto Amorim Afonso
description: A place where you can park your camper to enter the village.

title: (6050) Sao Simao - EM526
description: Park without gradient next to secondary road (with little movement), possível overnight. With WC.

title: (7340) - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful surroundings, nice fishing spots both upstream and down the river, lots of shade spots.

title: (6050) Montalvão - EM1139
description: Remote plot of land in the middle of the wild. 2 miles from the small town of Montalvão. Extended views of Portugal and Spain interior landscape, nearby Sever River. Surrounded by a Natural preserved Park. A quiet area perfect for night sky observation. Ideal for tents, camper vans and small motorhomes. The route from the village to the site is dirt road. Please call before arrival. Alan

title: (7440) - N369, ponte romana Vila Formosa
description: Approximately 100 m before East top of very well kept Roman bridge called “Vila Formosa”; nice place in nature with 5 tables and benches. Also suitable for overnight stays. The N369 is audible. Attention: you can reach here only from the East, because bridge is closed for cars. Without service.

title: (7460) Fronteira -
description: Picnic tables by the river with barbecue, there are trees so shadows. NOTE: strong flood in 2022-Dec, that overpass bridge and damaged it, may damage leisure equipment.

title: (6050) - N18
description: Small pic nick area, but with a very clean and fresh fountain with water

title: (7460-136) Fronteira - N 245 Ponte Ribeira Grande - N.
title_short: (7460-136) Fronteira - N 245 Ponte Ribeira Grande - N.
description: Extended P related to municipal swimming pool. Very nice area even to overnight. The river, the park is lit up at night. Wooden hiking trail “Passadiço da Ribeira Grande” starts opposite side of the bridge till Fronteira village. In S zone of village, interesting building about Atoleiros battle (in 1384; search “Centro de Interpretação”). NOTE: strong flood damaged bridge in 2022-Dec and road is cut; so, access only from N (via Alter do Chão).

title: (7460) Fronteira - Ponte Ribeira Grande - S
description: This is a small car park close to left riverside. Toilets open at the beginning of April. Very quiet. Besides swimming on river (low level) there is swimming pool on opposite riverside. Wooden hiking trail “Passadiço da Ribeira Grande” starts on top of bridge till Fronteira village. Museum about Atoleiros battle (in 1384), in S side of village, is very interesting (search “Centro de Interpretação da Batalha de Atoleiros”). Interior of church on top of this hill (“Senhora da Vila Velha” - ask visit on adjacent house) also nice. NOTE: bridge was damaged by strong flood in 2022-Dec, so road is cut 500m before.

title: (6040) Comenda (Castelo Cernado) - Unnamed Road
description: Parking of Ribeira da Venda beach. Very nice place to stay, has WC, shower for free, and place to washing your dishes. Also has an amazing surrounding.. Free pool for kids and a new one for adults. Stayed one nigth and had a very relaxing day. It also has a bar.

name: Ribeira da Venda
title: (6040) Ribeira da Venda
description: Nice place to spend day and overnight (no lightning) on both borders of very small river, 6 km away from N 118 road. Bar/restaurant owner told me the water was drinkable. There is a food button to get the water out. Children's playground and pools for them and adults; tables and grill with wooden and metal grid. Picturesque channel, with Roman bridge (now used as pedestrian). Bar closed off summertime, may be on Sundays rest of year;it’s Wi-Fi works. The toilets are not open but wooded. It's a real campsite, but without staff. Washbasin, tent area, playground. At the entrance there is a 3.5 t prohibition sign; as alternative and more flat, 100 m further turn to gravel way to the other riverside. Hiking PR 3. If you do not feel safe to overnight, drive to Comenda village where there is extended flat illuminated P at beginning of village (left side of road).

title: (7460) Fronteira - Unnamed Road
description: Free flat illuminated parking not marked on floor related to sportive zone, so convenient use out of busy hours. 4 places for up to 7,5m long between trees; others around. 150m away from atoleiros battle (1384) museum (“centro de interpretação”); coffee-bar at 100m. Easy access and quiet to overnight.

title: (7460) Fronteira - Rua da Estação
description: Good place to stay one night by the former train station (with lot of tiles panels all around well kept), aside school. Flat, illuminated, free, quiet, without trees (hot on summer daylight). Just behind train station is cycling track “Ecopista Atoleiros-Sulfúrea” following former train way.

title: (7450) - IP2
description: Picnic area, well signposted, a few tables, garbage cans and not much more. Plenty of room to park, any size. Good for a quick stop or a night's sleep. A bit of traffic after 6am due to the road. Good place for a few hours sleep near the road.

title: (10512) Herrera de Alcántara -
description: Pier in perfect condition currently unused

title: (10510) Santiago de Alcántara - CC-37
description: A small shady road ledge. We stopped for lunch but barely a car passed in 3 hours. It could be a good place to spend the night. You cannot camp.

title: (10511) Carbajo - 28 Calle los Jardines
description: Carbajo is a village of about 200 inhabitants, which on Magusto, the first day of the Celtic calendar, October 31 celebrates every year, making it one of the international Celtic - Folk festivals of greatest relevance in the autonomous community of Extremadura. On the foothills of the Sierra de San Pedro

title: (10513) Cedillo - EX-375
description: Small picnic area under an impressive cork oak. Shadow under it, fits the vehicle. Near the town of Cedillo. There is a bench table to eat and litter bins.

title: (10580) Membrío - Unnamed Road
description: Nice spot to stop for lunch or maybe even overnight as there are no prohibition signs. Right by the dam of the lake. No problem with access.

title: (06510) Alburquerque - 28 Calle Pozo Concejo
description: Parking next Machaco Hotel at the entrance of the village. There is little space, although there is not much room to park in the villa. In Duque Street, which is next, you can also park early. Although Google Maps appears with the ground, it is really asphalted.

title: (6050) Pardo - N18
description: Magnificent place with several pitches accessible with a motorhome, for the more adventurous there is a magnificent view of the valley at the end of the trail. We spent a quiet night there and enjoyed a sunny morning

title: (06510) Alburquerque - EX-110
description: Lpg and water

title: (10510) Santiago de Alcántara -
description: Picnic area in a very beautiful environment, next to a jetty and source of sulphurous waters. It is reached by a long track but it goes very well, in the final descent there is a sharp turn that with a van very well but with ac I do not know what.

title: (06510) Alburquerque -
description: Beautiful place on a piece of land between two estates. The dirt road to it is not so pretty, but I thought it was worth it. The area is used for recreation, by shepherds and unfortunately also by people to dump (large) waste. There is therefore some rubble here and there, despite the prohibition signs.

name: Camping Puro Alentejo
title: (7350) Camping Puro Alentejo
description: Located in the heart of Alto Alentejo, 3+0,3 km from the historic village of Barbacena and less than 20 min from the city of Elvas (classified as World Heritage by UNESCO), this rural camping is prepared to welcome motorhomes, caravans, tents and all those who seek the simplicity of the countryside and, above all, experiences to share in the moment and remember later.

title: (10580) Membrío - 2 Calle Huerto Zapatero
description: A quiet place to rest from a long trip, tranquility, silence and cozy, a complete and phenomenal breakfast option , excellent kindness!

title: (10513) Cedillo - EX-375
description:
Great place to spend a few days enjoying the area with all the great walks. Hard ground. Off the main road. Park near the trees and you will not be seen from what little traffic there is which ends at the dam and has no access to Portugal.
.

name: Embalse de Cedillo
title: (10513) Embalse de Cedillo
description: Parking next to the dam. No service, but a very friendly security guard. He came over and told us it was OK to spend the night there.

title: (7100-695) Veiros - 3 N372
description: Scale new to weight motorhomes and trucks, at border of N 372 road (km 41), with payment by coins or card. On top of soft hill with panorama, adequate for a short break. Diesel station 100m away.

title: (6050) Amieira do Tejo -
description: Small quiet place to spend the night by the water under the eucaliptos

title: (6050) Amieira do Tejo - Access to Barca da Amieira Trail
title_short: (6050) Amieira do Tejo - Access to Barca da Amieira Trail
description: Flat asphalt area (it was used for Fratel dam construction mobile residence) on isolation ambience at evening and night. Good place to overnight, very quiet and safe besides no lightning. Just a couple of trains during the night on opposite Tejo riverside. 5 min away from IP 2, near Fratel dam, so perfect if you are travelling. Very good to watch stars when no moonlight.

address.street: Access to Barca da Amieira Trail

name: Barragem de Fratel - IP 2
title: (6030) Barragem de Fratel - IP 2
description: Free flat P on Northern top of Fratel dam, Tejo river, without shadows. Perfect for a lunch stop! Nice views, path for walk.

title: (7100-684) Veiros - 17 Largo 25 de Abril
description: Flat renewed square (now without shadows) good to visit village (typical houses bordered with traditional colors; church on top of hill) or take a meal or coffee.

title: (6050) Amieira do Tejo - Trilho da Barca da Amieira - E top
title_short: (6050) Amieira do Tejo - Trilho da Barca da Amieira - E top
description:
Beautiful little free P in the hills just on left Tejo riverside, totally quiet. Spectacular view of the nearby dam and some fun hiking paths with art installations in nature. Very easy access on tarnac road. No services, no water. 
For vans up to 6m max (due to marks on floor of P), so not convenient for big motorhomes.

address.street: Trilho da Barca da Amieira - E top

title: (10570) Salorino - N-521
description: Rest area. You can stay overnight. Quiet place next to a road with little traffic. Picnic tables. Route for walking or bicycles.

title: (7350) Elvas - Unnamed Road
description: Ideal place to spend the night. You can get there by camper van if it hasn't rained a lot. We spent 2 nights very well...

title: (7350) - N243
description: Nice place, does not have any service, but the views are very good. You have to arrive by day, since it is difficult to enter the area with AC. A little dirty

title: (6030) - Unnamed Road
description: Small picnic area with barbecue on Tejo riverside. Possibility to park. We spent a very quiet night there. Accessible by a small path to vans and small trucks.

title: (6030) - Autoestrada da Beira Interior
description: Rest area is the main Highway (Motorway), A23, it has free water has air for check pressure in tires. Very clean bathroom, and good breakfast, with local products. Fill your tank of fuel and water (free and large flow). It has gas pump and bottles. Very good stop!

name: Barca da Amieira
title: (6050) Barca da Amieira
description: Just on left Tejo riverside at bottom of road to very small ferry. Currently, 2022-November, it is still under construction/improvement. 2 barbecue areas are built, the solar-powered small ferry too, 1 toilet house is set up for the hikers. Beginning of “Trilho da Barca da Amieira” wooden hiking, 3,6 km long.

title: (7350) Elvas - N243
description: Good place to spend a quiet weekend.

title: (7350) Barragem do Caia -
description: Cool to sleep on an islands

title: (6030-217) Vila Velha de Rodão - 210 Rua do Cabeço do Salvador
title_short: (6030-217) Vila Velha de Rodão - 210 Rua do Cabeço do Salvador
description: Carpark with a view of river . next to a bar and children’s play area . there’s also a gym here but i didn’t use it . short walk to river and town (it is the market place area with carpark) we used this side of the river when we tried the official town aire and a ‘festival was there’ so we couldn’t use it

title: (7350) Elvas - N243
description: Wonderful place not far from the road but enough not to hear noises in the night, it is very windy!

name: Barragem do Caia
title: (7370) Barragem do Caia
description: Parking in land, flat, overlooking the lake and pontoon for fishing or swimming. Good for a night without noise. No service

title: (06510) Alburquerque - EX-110
description: Just off the main road.  You can get about 30 m from the road.  Great for lunch or an overnight stop.

title: () Vila Velha de Rodão - 167 Rua do Porto do Tejo
title_short: () Vila Velha de Rodão - 167 Rua do Porto do Tejo
description: Place perfect for eating, resting and overnight. Very nice motorhome area, located in a beautiful natural environment (big trees but few places open for satellite) next to the yew, with a pier to visit the river and a restaurant at the foot of the river (about 100m from the area). Free wifi and water intake, emptying of chemical but NOT gray water by the moment (maybe reoperational Summer 2023); P illuminated. You rest well without noise and in the morning with the awakening of the birds. Walk 150m SSE and watch where high Tejo river flow arrived in 1979-Feb-10 (mark at left side) and 150m more to cross pedestrian wooden bridge over Enxarrique and arrive immediately at panels info about men occupation 30 000 years ago (Middle Palaeolithic); watch long metallic bridge over Tejo river when returning (very nice at night!). Small town Vila Velha de Ródão has interesting museum. Camping is closed all year round; its reception is tourist office. External toilets may function on Summertime.

title: (7370) Campo Maior - 3 Rua do Bairro de São Pedro
title_short: (7370) Campo Maior - 3 Rua do Bairro de São Pedro
description: Magnificent place to visit the castle…and spend the night…very quiet

address.street: 3 Rua do Bairro de São Pedro

title: (7350) Elvas - N 243 - 1km E Caia dam wall
title_short: (7350) Elvas - N 243 - 1km E Caia dam wall
description: Semi-abandoned service area, nowadays useful ONLY to drain wastewater (grey water). It is 100m away N 243 road and just outside of closed camping site.

title: (6030) Vila Velha de Rodão - Vila Velha de Ródão de, Castelo de Ródão (rei Wamba) e capela N. Sra Castelo
title_short: (6030) Vila Velha de Rodão - Vila Velha de Ródão de, Castelo de Ródão (rei Wamba) e capela N. Sra Castelo
description: Location is beautiful (on right side top of Tejo river natural narrow, called Portas de Ródão, 220m just above river) specially during sunset and sunrise. Also good to watch stars! Spent one night here, fine. 1 disadvantage that there is a nasty stench. Small free flat P can be busy during Summertime with cars of tourists that climb till point of view and old tower; if so, wait on previous parking space. NOTE: on summertime and weekends, stop at previous identified place and walk 300m to see if space available, because road is flat but narrow even to cross with cars.

address.street: Vila Velha de Ródão de, Castelo de Ródão (rei Wamba) e capela N. Sra Castelo

title: (6030) - Unnamed Road
description:
A few hundred meters before the (in the evenings) popular parking lot, you'll find this gem between the rocks. A small even surface next to the hiking trail. If you're a little lucky
, the clouds come in in the morning and you look at a fluffy cloudy surface. Leave it clean, there are toilets next to the castle. Even at night you can listen to the birds singing in the valley.

name: Piscina Municipal de Fratel
title: (6030) Piscina Municipal de Fratel
description: Service area easily accessible from A23 highway (search 150m gravel access direct from N 3 road, km 176,3, instead via village where you should have to bypass swimming pool!) with gravel free space to P and overnight (not illuminated and a bit unleveled). On summertime, open air swimming pool open and corresponding snack and toilets. Swimming pools (outdoor pools) in Portugal are generally only open from middle June to the end of August/September. NOTE: when swimming pool functions, access to service area during daytime may be impossible :-( because cars park under trees.

title: (6120) Vale Grou -
description: Place pour dormir avec une vue incroyable, compliqué de monté en camping car.

name: Senhora de Entre-águas,Benavila
title: (7480) Senhora de Entre-águas,Benavila
description: Six picnic tables in middle of olive trees between “Nossa Senhora de Entre-águas” 15th century chapel and Maranhão lake/dam, about 1 km N of Benavila. Extended view over dam, very nice at sunset. Chapel is national monument. Very old olive tree in front of main door.

title: () Vila Fernando - N 243-1 - 1 km N Vila Fernando
title_short: () Vila Fernando - N 243-1 - 1 km N Vila Fernando
description: Beautiful area around small dam about 150m E of road. Calm and pleasant; some shadows. Easy flat gravel access that has bifurcation (maybe better bottom of right). Unplanned early morning visit of sheep which put a smile on our faces. Swimming possible.

title: (6120) - Unnamed Road
description: Wonderful place at a small waterfall. Access not easy! Rather 4x4! There is also a source of drinking water! Absolute peace! Google maps: Pego da Rainha

title: (7350) Vila Fernando - 21 Largo da Independência
description: Fountain with two fresh water threaded taps (7m away from street border) inside typical flat village, aside church and “Taberna do Adro” typical small restaurant. To rest a little, use square in front of church (busy on meals time).

title: (7370-035) Campo Maior - Avenida Bombeiros Voluntários
description: Long free flat P parallel to avenue, between stadium and firemen station. Quiet enough by night to rest. No facilites.

title: (6030) Vila Velha de Ródão -
description: Place on the edge of the small road with a magnificent view! Be careful, the road to get there is narrow, difficult CC access!

title: (6030) Vila Velha de Ródão - Unnamed Road
title_short: (6030) Vila Velha de Ródão - Unnamed Road
description: Close to the Penedo Gordo Viewpoint.  Going up to the lookout post we have a 360° paradisiacal view.  Vila Velha de Ródão is at our feet as is the Tejo river.  We stayed 1 night without any problems. 4G at maximum level. Don't forget to collect your trash and also the distracted ones. Enjoy

title: (7470) Sousel - 12 N245
description: Large flat and illuminated gravel parking, without shadows, in front of tourist office and municipal library. Easy walking access to village center.

title: (6000-451) Lentiscais - Cais fluvial de Lentiscais
description: Nice "secret" flat free P surrounded by nature, on left Ponsul riverside that here is a lake, where you can swim with care. Next to river harbor for touristic Tejo cruisers. Some people leave their feces around the parking, but the river and shores are clean and awesome. NOTE: Be careful of piking rocks near the shore when swimming! They stick out even upto 5 m from the shore without anything around but water just below the surface.

name: Camping Rural Os Anjos
title: (7370-214) Camping Rural Os Anjos
description: Small Campsite just outside lovely Campo Maior (1,5 km E) with its supermarkets, restaurants and museums. It is 14 km from the Spanish border Badajoz and 20 km from Elvas. It has a beautiful view. You can do walking and cycling or visit nice towns. Nice atmosphere.

title: (6000-451) Castelo Branco - N18-8
description: Drinking water source accessible by the roadside!

title: (6030) - Represa do Retaxo
description: Small reservoir (named “Represa do Retaxo”) for fishermen, with picnic tables and a barbecue area. Absolutely quiet and clean, to admire the otters. Smooth dirt road 200 m from the small street and 2 km from the nearest village = Retaxo. Several impalements to park. No service, only garbage cans. Reception 4G.

title: (6000) Cebolais de Cima - 33 Rua Benemérito João Salavessa
title_short: (6000) Cebolais de Cima - 33 Rua Benemérito João Salavessa
description: Very quite place to sleep, very quite village with nice people, near Christian Motorcyclists Association, when opened they offer free amenities. Leveled.

title: (7470) Cano - Avenida do Rancho Folclórico
description:
Mix parking in the middle of the village.
Restaurant and café nearby

title: (6030-116) Sarnadas Rodão - AR IP2
description: Place to park day and night

title: (7350) Elvas - Unnamed Road
description:
Quiet and beautiful place next to the old church ruins and olive groves. A few options of where to park, flat and shade under the eucalyptus tree.

Much more secluded, clean and private than the other parking places by the fort, but same distance to aqueduct and town.

Track is passable in any size vehicle, a bit rough but very doable for anyone who isn't too precious about their vehicle.

Very peaceful at night, occasionally people visit in the day.

name: Estrada do Forte da Graça
title: (7350) Estrada do Forte da Graça
description: Well flat parking with extended panorama over Elvas fortress and city; not illuminated. On middle of climbing road to Fort Graça, where on top there is P too small and sloping on big cobblestone’s.

title: (7350) Elvas - N246
description: New parking on the access road to Forta de Graça. There is one at the beginning of the road and others at the top. We are in the middle. flat, beautiful view of the aqueduct.

title: (7350) Elvas -
description: Small spot in the forest not far from elvas, very pretty. Accessible but stony path. Ideal for this rest. We didn't spend the night. Unfortunately place a bit dirty….

title: (7350-466) Elvas - Unnamed Road
description: Cemetery parking, calm, flat and tarmac

title: (7350) Terrugem - 37 Rua Mandriana
description:
Quiet parking, located in front of a public park. Both public toilets, picnic area and barbecue and a petit bar. A soroll mica from the road. Nit no problemas.
------
Quiet parking in front of a park. With public toilet, picnic area and barbecue, also with a small bar. The road can be heard a little. Trouble free night.

At the entrance to the park it is indicated that camping is prohibited.

title: (7350) Terrugem - 7350 Largo Joaquim Cordeiro Vinagre
description: Quiet, large car park on the outskirts of the village. Easily accessible, also suitable for large motorhomes.

title: (7350) Terrugem - 18 Largo Joaquim Cordeiro Vinagre
description: Fairly large Parking on very near outskirts of village with artisanal service spot (cassette drain = grid with green rope). Choice of sun or shadow shade and sun. Quiet place, on the outskirts. Friendly and correct restaurants and cafe and traditional shopping in the village (see introduction of adjacent Parking). NOTE: market day on Wednesday and Saturday. Park along the field side.

title: (7100) Estremoz - IP2
description: Laundry self-service, with bathrooms, free Wi-Fi inside supermarket and bakery.

title: (7150) Borba - N4
description: Nice pic pic area. With a lake of trees, an abandoned building. Possibility to sleep on the spot. Dirty place, a lot of rubbish, but peaceful.
